New Records: Veterans Kucka and Peter Pekarík have now started all eight games Slovakia has ever played in the European finals tournament since first qualifying for the 2016 edition.
Key Match Events: Slovakia struck in the seventh minute through forward Ivan Schranz.
Romelu Lukaku had two goals ruled out by VAR.
Dávid Hancko made a brave goal-line block that left him with a face injury.
Belgium's Romelu Lukaku had two second-half goals overturned after being initially given by the match officials.
The second VAR intervention in the 86th minute judged that Loïs Openda handled the ball before his decisive pass to Lukaku.
Belgium fell to a first loss in 15 games under coach Domenico Tedesco.
Post-Match Reflections: Slovakia midfielder Stanislav Lobotka said, 'This win means a lot not just for me but the whole Slovak nation.'
Belgium coach Domenico Tedesco commented, 'I want to be at least a good, fair loser. We trust these guys. We just have to accept it.'

Slovakia coach Francesco Calzona praised Kucka and Pekarík, saying, 'Kucka, he is having an Indian summer in his career and I’m delighted with that,' and described Pekarík as 'a consummate professional.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: At the final whistle, the Slovakia squad and staff danced in front of their fans as their choice of victory music, 'Freed From Desire,' boomed out.
Slovakia pressing was energetic on Belgium’s makeshift defense despite fielding two 37-year-olds in outfield positions.
Belgium has gone three straight tournament games without scoring.
